extendedIngredients.name: half and half
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup milk or half and half

extendedIngredients.name: monterey jack cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 6 ounces Monterey Jack cheese, shredded (1 1/2 cups)

extendedIngredients.name: unsalted butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into small chunks

extendedIngredients.name: water
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 1/2 cups water, plus extra if needed

recipes.title: Creamy Skillet Mac & Cheese

winePairing.pairingText: Macaroni and Cheese can be paired with Lambrusco, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling. With rich, cheesy mac & cheese you'll want to cleanse the palate with something crisp and acidic. We recommend Chenin Blanc, Riesling, or dry Lambrusco if you're in the mood for a red. You could try PRONTO Lambrusco Secco. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: PRONTO Lambrusco Secco
productMatches.description: Crimson purple color. Aromas are rich with purple iris, clove and licorice. Medium-bodied, dry (secco), excellent concentration, rich finish, abundant fruit, dry. This wine offers complexity and richness on the palate.

recipes.instructions: In a large, 12-inch skillet, combine water, evaporated milk, salt and macaroni.  Heat over medium-high heat until simmering. Simmer for 9-12 minutes, or until pasta is tender.  Stir frequently to prevent sticking.Meanwhile, shred cheese and set aside.In a measuring cup, whisk together milk, cornstarch, mustard and hot sauce.  Set aside.Once noodles are tender, add milk mixture.  Stir and simmer until sauce thickens slightly, about 2 minutes.Remove from heat, and add cheese, one handful at a time.  Stir to combine after each addition.If you need additional liquid at this point, you can add a bit of water or milk/half and half to reach desired consistency.   I did add a couple of splashes of milk to mine.Add butter and stir.Season to taste with additional salt and black pepper.Enjoy warm.

steps.step: In a large, 12-inch skillet, combine water, evaporated milk, salt and macaroni.

Heat over medium-high heat until simmering. Simmer for 9-12 minutes, or until pasta is tender.  Stir frequently to prevent sticking.Meanwhile, shred cheese and set aside.In a measuring cup, whisk together milk, cornstarch, mustard and hot sauce.  Set aside.Once noodles are tender, add milk mixture.  Stir and simmer until sauce thickens slightly, about 2 minutes.

Remove from heat, and add cheese, one handful at a time.  Stir to combine after each addition.If you need additional liquid at this point, you can add a bit of water or milk/half and half to reach desired consistency.   I did add a couple of splashes of milk to mine.
Add butter and stir.Season to taste with additional salt and black pepper.Enjoy warm.
